meanings.definition: A term used to refer to American infantry soldiers during World War I.
meanings.sent1: The doughboys bravely fought in the trenches during the war.
meanings.sent2: Many people remember the doughboys for their courage in battle.
meanings.sent3: The doughboys decided to have a friendly snowball fight during their break.
meanings.sent4: The doughboys stood like statues, ready for any challenge.
meanings.sent5: The image of the doughboys marching into battle is etched in history.

meanings.definition: Small round pieces of dough, typically fried and served as a snack or dessert.
meanings.sent1: Grandma made delicious doughboys for us to enjoy after dinner.
meanings.sent2: The fair had a booth selling hot and fresh doughboys to the visitors.
meanings.sent3: The kids giggled as they shaped the doughboys into funny animal figures.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of cinnamon sugar doughboys filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The doughboys were so fluffy and warm, they melted in your mouth.
